ns:common.topic.description: Absys was an early declarative programming language from the University of Aberdeen. It anticipated a number of features of Prolog such as negation as failure, aggregation operators, the central role of backtracking and constraint solving. Absys was the first implementation of a logic programming language.\nThe name Absys was chosen as an abbreviation for Aberdeen System.
rdfs:label: Absys

ns:common.document.text: ABSYS was an early declarative programming language from the University of Aberdeen which anticipated a number of features of Prolog.

ns:type.object.name: Absys
